review_title: Very good place to work at
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Memphis, TN
pros: Flexible schedule, teamwork , Supportive leaders
cons: There are cons like every other place

pros: Staff and flexibility, decent work life balance
cons: Lack of structure and disorganized

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Memphis, TN
pros: The security department brings their belongings whatnot they are able.
cons: Patients are constantly asking us about supplies. We NEVER have the supplies needed. The soap in the dispensers is terrible (when it's there. But typically the techs bring it in.

pros: Benefits; shifts offered all the time; flexibility with prn; some units have great core staff that look out for one another
cons: No benefits for prn unless 30+ hours weekly worked; bonuses used to be a lot better; understaffed; management and employee turnover; administrative team really doesn’t do much to help core staff; can be dangerous on some units

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Memphis, TN
pros: Great coworkers, salary negotiation, schedule flexibiltity
cons: Disorganized, can be very dangeroous

pros: Love it because employees nice
cons: Managers too stick up to me

job_title: Business Development Representative in Memphis, TN
pros: Good people, but turnover is high
cons: Corporate tends to befuddle the development of the team, meaning that experienced members are excelling at their job and territory, yet constant reports and changes to implement are constant and the Directors fail to be the buffer to this most often inane ideas from corporate. It was obvious that Regional Directors seek to implement their own methods just to report changes they have made to prove they are making a difference, when actually they are continually adding to the already burden-some team member. UHS has a problem of micromanaging from Corporate that affects the outcome to the daily worker filling the beds and gathering referrals.

pros: good pay and good benefits
cons: hard to take off work

pros: good benefits; fair pay; I liked my team
cons: micro management, exec management really struggles

pros: Great place to work with amazing benefits.
cons: There is nothing bad about working here.

pros:
Valuable experience working with a multitude of mental health disorders. Ability to learn quickly due to being thrown into everything right away. 

I honestly do enjoy the people I work with, and they’re the only reason (aside from caring about patients) that I haven’t left yet.
cons:
Staff in every department are immensely overworked. Patients are herded like cattle through an assembly line with little effort made to actually help them.  There are entirely too many patients to be cared for. Therapist caseloads are astronomical and prevent us from providing patient care. Nursing is grossly understaffed, to the point that staff to patient ratios are in violation with CMS standards. Staff don’t receive much support from upper management, and administration is all too quick to throw direct care staff under the bus. 

Certain physicians contracted through Lakeside are completely unethical in their practice, and commit insurance fraud daily. It’s very frustrating when your voice isn’t heard and you don’t feel valued as a treatment team member. 

There isn’t much room to advance in your career unless you’re friends with the CEO. Then you’ll be fine.

review_title: Some good folks working a bad system
job_title: Case Manager FACT Team in Orlando, FL
pros: coworkers generally good people,  some patients really do get needed help
cons: poor pay, no advancement, no raise, not much of a bonus, revolving door policies which really just put patients on a drug replacement program. most patients never improve much nor do they want to.    HR will turn there back on you quickly even if you have done nothing wrong.

job_title: Behavioral Health Therapist in Germantown, TN
pros: Baptism by fire- lots of disorders presented in a short amount of time.  A chance to learn very quickly and not much hand holding.
cons: Very little security and huge case load, not very much help on obtaining your license, very stressful work environment not very helpful nurses or staff

pros: Lakeside BHS is an excellent employer that provides excellent opportunities for upward mobility. The company also offers an outstanding benefits package to FT/PT staff.
cons: I do not have any cons to report.

review_title: Where mental health goes to die.
pros: Well, I guess it's a job and they pay you.
cons: Facilities are consistently falling apart, the pay is terrible, and the management is a joke.

pros: Insurance is cheap, they offer insurance and pto benefits, nothing
cons: Pay, no way to move up without master degree, raises are like 15 cents and 10 cents no higher.

review_title: Could be a great place to work but needs much improvement
pros:
Working with patients of varying mental health issues
High possibility for advancement
cons: Unrealistic expectations, paper charting system, poor leadership, poor work-life balance, unprofessional coworkers (not all), no training

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Memphis, TN
pros: It is friendly and good place to work. Acceptable pay and the are advocate of their employees.Great job for those that are looking.
cons: Like any company they have their down falls as well. Documentation is still paper charting and it is a while lot of walking.

pros: Benefits after only 30 days, LOTS of overtime available, exposure to a variety of patients
cons: Poor training and orientation, staff members work outside of their scope of practice/licensure, staff calling out every shift, short staffed units, staff turns over every few weeks

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Memphis, TN
pros: Patients are seeking help for their addiction or behavioral issues and are cooperative and that interaction was fulfilling b/c I was able to actually feel like a nurse.
cons: Extremely rare time to actually have conversations with patients. Poor patients were herded around like cattle. As a nurse, I was not able to ptovide decent care. And pay was pitiful with no raise ever.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Memphis, TN
pros: Good Benefits (Pretty Good PTO and health),  Pay is better than same other competitors,
cons: Short Staffing.  You will be doing the work without enough mental health techs(Often poorly trained) or other nurses.

review_title: I would not recommend this as a career path, only as a job.
pros: Lakeside has great Insurance benefits!
cons:
Upper manager cares nothing about your concerns.
Absolutely no overtime.
May be sent home if the census is low.
No room for advancement.
Upper management has their "picks" for job advancement.

review_title: Good company in the behavioral health area
pros:
Great Co-Workers
Management was involved
Culture is geared toward helping the patients
cons:
Work is very stressful
Patience is a requirement every day

job_title: Licensed Outpatient Counselor in Memphis, TN
pros: Casual, cohesive and friendly work environment
cons: Not much communication with upper management with regards to company changes

pros: Benefits, a lot of the coworkers are great. Lots of opportunity for overtime.
cons: Working over, not great work-life balance.

pros: Lots of face to face time with patients
cons: Pay is far from good

pros: Great benefits, beautiful campus, understanding management.
cons: Understaffed in most departments, makes for stressful and undesirable work environment
